comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: members.shaw.ca/dwlynn/russian/russianid.htm has one picture that looks a bit like the grenades, the Novikov & Feodorov. And then I found a forum www.bocn.co.uk/vbforum/threads/84812-WW1-Russian-grenade-... where someone has posted a link to this picture, presumably hoping for identification of the device.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content:
And an identification came (at the forum I linked to above):
"This is the Russian WW1 Novitski grenade for breaching barb wire obstacles. Usually they had 4 thin ropes/strings attached which had small end pieces which would entangle in barb wire obstacles. "
